page.title: 16THE COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: Before 1894 local authority rested mainly with the Church and Vestry, together with bodies such as the Sanitary Board. The Government Act of that year instituted "Parish Councils" to take charge of local affairs - but with very little finance. Then the Local Government Act of 1972 changed the situation so that from 1 April 1974 there came into being the "Community Council" with many new powers and rights, including the vetting of planning applications. The limitations on spending were also greatly eased. Hundleton Community Council has nine members including the Chairman - at present Mr Graham Rowlands. It aims to enable the views of ordinary people to influence administration, - to "oil the environment's wheels, making a smooth and enjoyable community."
